job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Alexandria, VA
pros: You can move up through the ranks and great management
cons: Might have to stay for multiple years

pros: The ortanization really does care about the patients and offers great services from medical, dental, behavioral health plus has a food pantry
cons: Leadership appears to have their hands tied due to the micromanaging of the ceo

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Nashville, TN
pros: Um…let me think about this one
cons: The majority of the clinic managers have no idea of what they’re doing.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: It’s a great place to be
cons: Nothing bad about here honestly

job_title: Accounts Payable Specialist in Nashville, TN
pros: I learned such a great amount of experience with UNHS.  Working for a non-profit is a great deal because you see how hard the staff at the clinics work and how humble they are with all patients
cons: New administration brought changes that weren't actually suitable for everyone.  Many staff that were great left unfortunately.  New CEO believed those who likes gossips and that's unfortunate.

review_title: There is a job for everyone.
pros: It is true there is a job for everyone here. Many only need a few months and others longer. Serving the community for over 41 years, but only 2 employees have retired with 30 years. Community comes first and I am so proud to have been a part of so many great things brought to the communities we serve. When I started I did not know if I wanted to be a nurse any longer. Neighborhood Health aided in healing me, I am worthy and I do make a difference. Our patients heal us also.
cons: All this greatness does come with a cost...so many great employees lost including myself.

review_title: Cut the head off the snake!
pros: The clinic staff.  They are underpaid, and treated badly by administration. Admin does not care about employees..only themselves.  Admin motto is "if they don't like it somebody else will take their job"
cons: The administration.  CEO needs to retire, but doesn't trust anybody in the leadership to take over. They have a HR person who has no experience or talent for the position.  She is CEO hired gun.  HR has cost more money to the company so there is no money or bonus or raises for staff unless it i for the Admin Staff.

pros: Good benefits and vacation. Great co-workers and flexibility in work environment.
cons: Set schedule. Occasionally high turnover in some positions making it difficult to have set protocols.

review_title: Bad....bad....bad......was asked to in meetings to support a particular political party!
pros: If you want a slacker job where most of the management do not work one minute more than 40 hours, then this is the job for you!
cons: The culture is a complete top down mentality.  No one is credited with their good ideas, until the CEO comes up with the idea.
